definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: Sheila's dad is a real tight wad.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的父亲真是个一毛不拔的铁公鸡。

sentences.english: A cotton wad that was impregnated with ether.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的父亲真是个一毛不拔的铁公鸡。

sentences.english: An iron rooster in Chinese means miserly.
sentences.chinese: 铁公鸡在汉语中的意思是一毛不拔。

sentences.english: A black iron cock sits on the spire of the town church.
sentences.chinese: 一只黑色的铁公鸡坐在村里教堂的塔尖上。

sentences.english: Even if you can't admit to Japan also impossible what all don't buy.
sentences.chinese: 即使你再怎么铁公鸡，到了日本也不可能什么都不买。

sentences.english: Miser and rust, you TMD is a stainless steel.
sentences.chinese: 铁公鸡还有生锈的时候，你TMD简直是个不锈钢的。

sentences.english: There was once a very poor person who was also very stingy.
sentences.chinese: 从前有个又穷又铁公鸡的人向上帝祷告。

definition: goblin that kills or harms people/fig. wicked scoundrel/terrible pest
lit. to grab feathers from a flying goose/fig. to seize any opportunity/pragmatic
Zhou the exploiter, archetypal character in short story 半夜雞叫|半夜鸡叫[ban4 ye4 ji1 jiao4]
lit. to love money as much as one's own life (idiom)/fig. avaricious/tightfisted
